answers.answer: Blood drawn maybe an ultrasound talk. Talk to you about everything. Tell you what you can and can't eat and do. Just the basics.
And tell you to make an appointment with a doctor to make sure that your baby doesn't have gestational diabetes and other birth defects

Expect some type of physical, mine checked my breast and my abdomen and they did a pap/culture. They check your cervix too. The exciting part is that they let you hear the heart beat! They also take a few viles of blood and a urine sample. Bring a list of symptoms and questions you have so you don't forget anything! The paper work they give you will ussually be really long and thorough so make sure you arrive early! Ask for a list of safe medications or bring a pen and paper to write down anything they say - you will want to know ahead of time what you can take if you get sick!
I'm pretty sure they may give you an ultrasound as well just to make sure the baby is ok.

They will most likely do Blood work , urine sample, weight, blood pressure, and go over your health history. If you get a sono today they should easily be able to tell you what you are having :) my next appt is on the 27 this month and I'll be exactly 17 weeks. I'll get to find out the gender then. I'm soooo excited!

question: Im going to see an obgyn for the first time during my pregnancy! Im 17 weeks. What things should i expect to happen on my first visit?
title: excited!!!
